intro: Banisteria tristellocarpa, commonly known as the purple-leafed stinkwood, is a woody plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its striking purple foliage and fragrant, tubular flowers. The plant produces small, clustered fruits that contain several seeds. It is often found in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests. Its unique appearance and ecological role make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
